means: 不能修复的，不可弥补的

sentence.Network_en: Incidents of this type cause irreparable damage to relations with the community.
sentence.Network_cn: 这类事件会对与该社群的关系造成不可弥合的伤害。

sentence.Network_en: The move would cause irreparable harm to the organization.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一举措会对该组织造成不可弥补的损害。

sentence.Network_en: Her death is an irreparable loss to the firm.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的去世对公司是不可弥补的损失.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 一些翻译~（转的~） ... irrational 荒谬的 irreparable 不可挽回的 irreverent 无礼的.
职称英语专业考试相关词汇_百度文库 ... Resigned 顺从的， 64． Irreparable 不能挽回的 65． Blunder’ 大错，失误 66．.
新编大学英语单词表(第三册) - 豆丁网 ... glycerin n. 甘油 irreparable a. 无法修复的，不可弥补的 lifeboat n. 救生船.
新编大学英语单词表(第三册) - 豆丁网 ... glycerin n. 甘油 irreparable a. 无法修复的，不可弥补的 lifeboat n. 救生船.

list.abs: 2.无可弥补的损害（irreparable injury）专利权是财产权既然属于财产权其损害自然可以金钱补偿。
雅思写作十大原则 - 豆丁网 ... illegal adj. 违法的，不合规定的 irreparable harm 不能弥补的伤害 landscape n. 风景.
首页 ... irrelevant 无关系的 irreparable harm 无法弥补的 issue 问题、争议、议题.
弥补-的英语翻译-bab.la词典 ... 不能弥补的 irrecoverable 不可弥补的损失 irreparable damage 弥补的 redeeming.
产能燃料相关词... ... 晶格不规则性 irregularity， lattice 不能修补损害 irreparable damage 不可逆过程 irreversible process.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin irreparabilis, from in- 'not' + reparabilis (see reparable)

entry.tran: 不能修复的;不可弥补的;无可挽救的
entry.def: Irreparable damage or harm is so bad that it cannot be repaired or put right.

example.ex: The move would cause irreparable harm to the organization.
example.tran: 这一举措会对该组织造成不可弥补的损害。

means.word_mean: 1. impossible to repair, rectify, or amend;

auth_sentence.content: Oing said Friday that Macy's didn't prove irreparable harm.
auth_sentence.res_content: Oing said Friday that Macy's didn't prove irreparable harm.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Oing said Friday that Macy's didn't prove irreparable harm.

auth_sentence.content: These inhuman crimes do irreparable damage to the good name of Ireland.
auth_sentence.res_content: These inhuman crimes do irreparable damage to the good name of Ireland.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These inhuman crimes do irreparable damage to the good name of Ireland.

auth_sentence.content: It might not be only your street cred which suffers irreparable damage.
auth_sentence.res_content: It might not be only your street cred which suffers irreparable damage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It might not be only your street cred which suffers irreparable damage.

means.word_mean: 不能修复的;不可弥补的

sentences.en: Her death is an irreparable loss to the firm.
sentences.cn: 她的去世对公司是不可弥补的损失。
